alert.note: Alert for Bitterroot, Sapphire Mountains; Lower Clark Fork Region; Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 6:05PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Missoula County through 630 PM MDT... At 604 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles west of Lolo, or 13 miles southwest of Missoula, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Missoula, Lolo and East Missoula. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 103 and 108. Highway 93 S between mile markers 84 and 94. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Bitterroot, Sapphire Mountains; Lower Clark Fork Region; Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region
